labs.instructions:
Get 2 sets from 2 different sites, (one from central line if any) 
1 set = 1 anaerobic bottle and 1 aerobic bottle
Total bottles = 4 if getting 2 sets
labs.additionalInformation: samples to be taken prior to administration of antibiotics. but antibiotic administration not to be delayed for blood culture samples

under ultrasound guidance. 
if coagulopathy or short neck- to consider femoral insertion.

documents.name: CBC W Differential panel, method unspecified (Bld)
documents.label: CBC

author.name: Dr. Dileep Unnikrishnan ABIM, Internal Medicine

components.value:
Assessment: 


CNS: 

Change in GCS: 

Pupils: 

Neuroprotective measures: 


CVS: 

Rhythm: 

BP: 

Vasopressors: 


Resp: 

Change in Spo2: 

Ventilator settings: 

SAT/SBT: 


Abdomen/Nutrition: 


Renal(urine output/RFT review/Dialysis): 


Medication review: 


Glycemic check: 


Skin assessment (bedsore care, thrombophlebitis): 


Status of Invasive lines/tubes(Site,assessment/care): 


Prophylaxis (GI/DVT/ Ambulation): 


Investigations /Imaging review:

To do list/follow up: 


Pending: 

Planned procedures (Surgery, blood transfusion, Hemodialysis):

Subjective

The patient is a 42-year-old right-handed male brought to the Emergency Department by EMS after experiencing a generalized tonic-clonic seizure lasting approximately 3 minutes at home, witnessed by his wife. Postictal confusion persisted for ~20 minutes. He has no known prior history of seizures. Wife reports no recent illness, medication changes, or trauma. No history of alcohol or drug use.


Objective

Vital Signs on Arrival:

  • T: 37.1°C
  • HR: 102 bpm
  • BP: 148/90 mmHg
  • RR: 20/min
  • SpO₂: 98% on room air

Physical Examination:

  • General: Drowsy but arousable, oriented x1
  • HEENT: PERRLA, no head trauma, oropharynx clear
  • Neuro:
  • CN: Intact II-XII
  • Motor: 5/5 strength all extremities
  • Sensory: Grossly intact
  • Reflexes: 2+ throughout, downgoing plantar
  • Gait: Not assessed
  • CV: Regular rhythm, no murmurs
  • Resp: Clear to auscultation bilaterally
  • Abd: Soft, non-tender
  • Skin: No rash or injuries

Labs (ED Labs):

  • CBC: WNL
  • BMP: Na 132, K 4.1, Glucose 95, BUN 12, Cr 0.9
  • LFTs: Normal
  • TSH: Pending
  • Urine tox: Negative
  • EtOH: Negative
  • Lactate: Mildly elevated at 2.4

Imaging:

  • CT Head (non-contrast): No acute intracranial process
  • CXR: Clear lung fields

EEG: Pending

MRI Brain: Scheduled for tomorrow

Assessment

42-year-old male with new-onset generalized tonic-clonic seizure, currently postictal, admitted to the ICU for close neurologic monitoring and workup. No prior seizure history. Etiology unclear at this time; differentials include structural lesion, metabolic derangement, idiopathic epilepsy, or less likely CNS infection.

author.name: Dr. Dileep Unnikrishnan ABIM, Internal Medicine

components.value: Summary: Bhavana, 34-year-old female, with no known comorbidities, presented with c/o of respiratory distress. On arrival to ICU, patient was stable with blood pressure 140/75, heart rate 112, respiratory rate 24, and oxygen saturation 96% on 50% FiO2. Patient was on invasive ventilation with PEEP 6 and pressure support 10. Abnormal labs showed pH 7.32, PaCO2 80.2, PaO2 36, bicarbonate 40.5, potassium 3.24, chloride 94, creatinine 2.9, urea nitrogen 102, sodium 134, potassium 3.5, chloride 102.6, and creatinine clearance 17 ml/min.

Assessment: 


  • CNS:  GCS: E2V4M4
  • CVS: HR: 68 bpm, BP: 130/80 mm of hg
  • RS: RR: 20 /min, SpO2: 99 %, 21 % FiO2
  • Abdomen/Nutrition: Patient is NPO (Nothing by mouth).
  • ID/Lines/Tubes: No invasive lines are currently ordered.
  • Hematology: CBC to be repeated
  • Endocrine: Glucose to be updated
  • Prophylaxis: Patient is not on DVT chemoprophylaxis.

Todo: 

  • Adjust antibiotic doses due to renal impairment
  • Dress bedsore on right gluteal region

Summary: Bhavana, 34-year-old female, with no known comorbidities, presented with c/o of respiratory distress. On arrival to ICU, patient was stable with blood pressure 140/75, heart rate 112, respiratory rate 24, and oxygen saturation 96% on 50% FiO2. Patient was on invasive ventilation with PEEP 6 and pressure support 10. Abnormal labs showed pH 7.32, PaCO2 80.2, PaO2 36, bicarbonate 40.5, potassium 3.24, creatinine 2.9, urea nitrogen 102, sodium 134, and creatinine clearance 17 ml/min. Patient had a bedsore on the right gluteal region.

Assessment: 


  • CNS:  GCS: E2V4M4
  • CVS: HR: 68 bpm, BP: 130/80 mm of hg
  • RS: RR: 20 /min, SpO2: 99 %, 21 % FiO2
  • Abdomen/Nutrition: Patient is NPO (Nothing by mouth).
  • ID/Lines/Tubes: No invasive lines are currently ordered.
  • Hematology: CBC to be repeated
  • Endocrine: Glucose to be updated
  • Prophylaxis: Patient is not on DVT chemoprophylaxis.

Todo: 

  • Adjust Meropenem and Levofloxacin doses due to renal impairment
  • Dress bedsore on the right gluteal region
